Wisdom: تَوَخَّ رِضَا اللَّهِ وَتَوَقَّ سَخَطَهُ وَزَعْزِعْ قَلْبَكَ بِخَوْفِهِ
enWisdom: Seek the pleasure of Allah and fear His displeasure, and let your heart become unsettled by [your] fear of Him

Wisdom: تَحَرَّ رِضَى اللَّهِ وَتَجَنَّبْ سَخَطَهُ فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَدَ لَكَ بِنَقِمَتِهِ وَلَا غِنَى بِكَ عَنْ مَغْفِرَتِهِ وَلَا مَلْجَأَ لَكَ مِنْهُ إِلَّا إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Seek the pleasure of Allah, and keep away from His displeasure, for indeed there is none who can save you from His retribution and there is nothing that can make you needless of His forgiveness, and there is no refuge for you from Him except with Him

Wisdom: رِضَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ أَقْرَبُ غَايَةٍ تُدْرَكُ
enWisdom: The pleasure of Allah, the Glorified, is the nearest goal that can be achieved

Wisdom: شُغِلَ مَنْ كَانَتِ النَّجَاةُ وَمَرْضَاةُ اللَّهِ مَرَامَهُ
enWisdom: He one whose goal is salvation and attaining the pleasure of Allah is [always] occupied
The highest goal is in [attaining] the pleasure of Allah

Wisdom: مَا أَعْظَمَ حِلْمَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ عَنْ أَهْلِ الْعِنَادِ وَمَا أَكْثَرَ عَفْوَهُ عَنْ مُسْرِفِي الْعِبَادِ
enWisdom: How great is the clemency of Allah, the Glorified, upon the recalcitrant, and how great is His forgiveness to the extravagant servants

Wisdom: تَوَقَّ سَخَطَ مَنْ لَا يُنْجِيكَ إِلَّا طَاعَتُهُ وَلَا يُرْدِيكَ إِلَّا مَعْصِيَتُهُ وَلَا يَسَعُكَ إِلَّا رَحْمَتُهُ وَالْتَجِئْ إِلَيْهِ وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Be wary of the displeasure of the One aside from whose obedience nothing can save you, and aside from whose disobedience nothing can destroy you, and aside from whose mercy nothing can accommodate you; and turn to Him and trust in HimBe wary of the displeasure of the One aside from whose obedience nothing can save you, and aside from whose disobedience nothing can destroy you, and aside from whose mercy nothing can accommodate you; and turn to Him and trust in Him

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُحِبَّ أَعْدَاءَ اللَّهِ أَوْ تُصْفِيَ وُدَّكَ لِغَيْرِ أَوْلِيَاءِ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ مَنْ أَحَبَّ قَوْماً حُشِرَ مَعَهُمْ
enWisdom: Beware of loving the enemies of Allah or having sincere affection for other than the friends of Allah, for indeed whoever loves a group of people is resurrected with them

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَا يُسْخِطُ رَبَّكَ وَيُوحِشُ النَّاسَ مِنْكَ فَمَنْ أَسْخَطَ رَبَّهُ تَعَرَّضَ لِلْمَنِيَّةِ وَمَنْ أَوْحَشَ النَّاسَ تَبَرَّأَ مِنَ الْحُرِّيَّةِ
enWisdom: Be sure to keep away from that which angers your Lord and alienates people from you, for the one who angers his Lord is faced with annihilation and one who alienates people renounces freedom

Wisdom: إِنَّ مِنْ أَبْغَضِ [بَعْضِ‏] الْخَلَائِقِ إِلَى اللَّهِ تَعَالَى رَجُلًا وَكَلَهُ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ جَائِراً عَنْ قَصْدِ السَّبِيلِ سَائِراً بِغَيْرِ دَلِيلٍ
enWisdom: Verily, one of the creatures most hated by Allah, the Exalted, is the man who has been left on his own [by Allah] and has strayed from the right path, moving on without a guide
